sslyzetestsuite module¶

class sslyzetestsuite.SSLyzeTestSuite(engine_name='Custom Engine')¶

Bases: testsuite.TestSuite

connect(scheme, address, port)¶

Run all configurations necessary to perform a test against the target. This function is mean to set up the connection to the target. The function should work for one or two specified ports if supported by engine

Parameters:
  • scheme (str) – http or https
  • port –
Param:

address
Type:

str
generate_test_list(testfile='tests.csv')¶

This function must make a array of Test objects representing each of the tests that can be executed by the engine. The list must be compatible for the run_tests function

Returns:List of Test objects
Return type:Array[Test…]
import_policy(path, name)¶

Import testing policy from file. This makes the initial configuration of which tests that are enabled. As well as other policies such as strength and sensitivity

Parameters:
  • path (str) – File path to config file
  • name (str) – Policy name, may be useful for the engine
is_certificate_info_secure(scan_result)¶

Return true if certificate info is secure :param scan_result: Results from sslyze scan :return: bool

is_compression_secure(scan_result)¶

Return true if compression is performed securely :param scan_result: Results from sslyze scan :return: bool

is_early_data_secure(scan_result)¶

Return true if th early data plugin is supported :param scan_result: Results from sslyze scan :return: bool

is_fallback_scsv_secure(scan_result)¶

Return true if the fallback function used is secure :param scan_result: Results from sslyze scan :return: bool

is_heartbleed_secure(scan_result)¶

Return true the application is secure from hearthbleed vulnerability :param scan_result: Results from sslyze scan :return: bool

is_http_headers_secure(scan_result)¶

Return true if the http headers are secure :param scan_result: Results from sslyze scan :return: bool

is_open_ssl_cihper_suites_secure(command, scan_result)¶

Return true if the given result shows a secure cipher suite, else return false

Parameters:
  • command – Transport layer protocol
  • scan_result – Results from sslyze scan
Returns:

bool
is_openssl_css_injection_secure(scan_result)¶

Return true if the application is secure from css injection :param scan_result: Results from sslyze scan :return: bool

is_robot_secure(scan_result)¶

Return true if the application is secure from the robot attach :param scan_result: Results from sslyze scan :return: bool

is_session_renegotiation_secure(scan_result)¶

Return true if the session renegotiation is secure :param scan_result: Results from sslyze scan :return: bool

is_session_resumption_secure(scan_result)¶

Return true if the session resumption is secure :param scan_result: Results from sslyze scan :return: bool

run_tests(tests)¶

Run all enabled tests against the target url with the http or https port specified in the connect function. The Test objects within the tests array describes each test. The array should be changed according to the outcome, and if both ports have been specified and are supported the results must be merged before returned.

Parameters:
  • tests (Array[Test...]) – Array of Test objects
  • targetURL (str) – The target including address and port
Returns:

Array of test objects
Return type:

Array[Test…]
server_info = None¶
shutdown()¶

Some external engines needs to be properly shut down before closing the python program

start()¶

” Most testing tools needs to be started before they can be interacted with. Even if this is just a python module the class should be initiated here.

stop()¶

Stop all running tests
